intro: Xolisma alpina, commonly known as the alpine xolisma, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. This plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers bloom in clusters, and it has a distinctive, branched stem. Xolisma alpina is adapted to cold climates and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes.
